About

I’m a third-year PhD student in the Climate-Ocean-Atmosphere Program at Scripps Institution of Oceanography, University of California, San Diego. As an oceanographer, I strive to understand the physical aspects of the ocean and its role in climate system.

I grew up in São Paulo in the southeast of Brazil. I went to school at University of Sao Paulo (USP), where I’ve met awesome friends and I fell in love with applied mathematics, data science, and free software. I also developed a strong sense of justice. This may sound cliché but I’m committed to apply my skills to improve the world.

In my free time I enjoy listening to music, reading, biking, surfing, and swimming. I’m a big fan of Jorge Ben, jazzy Bossa Nova, piano concerts, Portuguese literature, and The New Yorker.
